meanings.definition: The act of preserving a dead body by embalming and wrapping in cloth.
meanings.sent1: During the museum tour, we saw the ancient mummying process.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist studied the mummying techniques of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: At the Halloween party, Sarah's mummying costume was so realistic!
meanings.sent4: The mummying of the pharaoh was a solemn ritual, preserving his legacy.
meanings.sent5: The mummying of the king was a fascinating glimpse into the past.

meanings.definition: The act of caring for and nurturing a child.
meanings.sent1: Parenting involves a lot of mummying to ensure a child's well-being.
meanings.sent2: She showed great love through her mummying of the orphaned children.
meanings.sent3: The babysitter's mummying skills made her the favorite among the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her mummying nature shone through as she comforted the crying baby.
meanings.sent5: The mother's mummying was evident in the way she hugged her child tightly.

meanings.definition: The act of pretending to be a mummy for Halloween.
meanings.sent1: The children had fun mummying themselves with toilet paper for the costume party.
meanings.sent2: He won the costume contest with his creative mummying outfit.
meanings.sent3: The mummying contest at the school was filled with laughter and fun.
meanings.sent4: She excelled at mummying during Halloween, scaring everyone with her slow walk.
meanings.sent5: The mummying game at the party was a hit, with everyone wrapped in bandages.
